"Currently, scientists have named and successfully classified over 1.5 million species. It is estimated that there are as little as 2 million to as many as 50 million more species that have not yet been found and/or have been incorrectly classified. Estimates vary from scientist to scientist because it is close to impossible to truly know whether there are any more species living that are not by the tip of the scientists' noses. As fields such as microbiology progress, scientists of taxonomy become more capable of accurately classifying species of the past and present."

Yea. sinjin's right. There are just so many that we don't even know that we don't know about. Someone once said that if you wanted to discover a new species of insect, all you had to do was to shake a tree in the rain forest.
 
 There are about 800,000 to 850,000 species of beetle alone. That doesn't leave much room for the rest of the insects before you top a million. Then it depends on what you are talking about. Animals? What kind? How about plants and fungi?
 
 Anyway, species in the millions that are living today. Estimates from the fossil record indicate that over 99% of species that have populated the earth at one time or another have gone extince. Just think of the 5 great extinction events, a couple of which nearly wiped out everything.

And what did Noah do about the termites?

 ..lest we forget the principle descriptor of life beneath the surface of the seas (it's all underwater), please...everybody...recall that Noah did not have to save the fishes. The fishes could not have been adversely affected by even a year long rain.
 
 However, the seals and the fishing cats could not have survived for a year without eating, so Noah must have had some poles, hooks and bait over the sides to help feed the mammalian fish eaters, kingfishers, pelicans, terns, penguins and the like. Lucky for him, there was only a pair of each, huh?

Fresh water fish might have had difficulty if the oceans covered the Earth.
N.Wells

Noah absolutely would have had to look after all the fishes. Remember that the Flood is supposed to have been responsible for depositing the geological column (or most of it - it's hard to get creationists to commit to exact beginnings and endings). In some places this can amount to 10-15 miles thickness of sediment, but let's assume an average of just 2 miles. All of that sediment has to be suspended in the raging flood waters very early in the flood. Creationists like to say that the oceans weren't as deep as today and mountains weren't as high before the flood, so that less water is needed, but let's assume 3 miles depth anyway. Try putting a mix of 2 parts mud to 3 parts water into your fish tank and see how the fish do. Fresh or salt, it makes no difference, they're goners.
Kronus

Fresh water fish might have had difficulty if the oceans covered the Earth.

 
 It actually would have worked both ways. Dumping that much fresh water into the oceans would have made them much less saline. The world would have been covered with water that was too saline for the fresh water fish and too fresh for the salt water fish. None of them would have survived.

Antibogotes

Two answers: they were either of the ant kind and didn't eat wood until they underwent hyperevolution after the landing of the ark, or they were placed in a suspended state of hibernation by 'Awlmighty Gawd' (only two - one male and one female, in spite of the fact that termites don't actually propagate that way).  Um, no. Seven pair of every clean (kosher) animal, and two pair of the unclean (trafe). (I like the seven pairs of each species of elephant best.) Insects are unclean. So you need two termite queens and two males of each species of termite. Then you have to decide whether to take any non-breeding female workers and the colony apparatus, or whether you want to take care of the queens and their later offspring yourself until the colonies can function on their own again.
 
 PS I find that it is much more fun, with much less aggro, to agree with Creationists and work around to the contradictions, rather than to tell them they're wrong. 
 
 Of course people in that advanced state of cognitive dissonance are as incapable of seeing their contradictions as if they had been hypnotized. Cognitive dissonance was first described in a church where the prediction of the end of the world on a certain day had failed, and the church grew as a direct result.
pandion

Um, no. Seven pair of every clean (kosher) animal, and two pair of the unclean (trafe).
I don't think that the Bible is quite clear on that subject. I have seen some discussion before about whether Noah took 7 of each clean animal, as opposed to 7 pair. However, as I read Genesis, it seems pretty clear that Noah was to take 2 (not 2 pair) of every unclean animal, you know, male and female.
 
(I like the seven pairs of each species of elephant best.)
I had never considered whether elephants were clean or unclean before. However, there are 3 extant species of elephant, and at least 4 times that many species of mammoth and mastodon. How interesting that Noah had over 200 of these huge animals aboard.
 
Insects are unclean. So you need two termite queens and two males of each species of termite.
That's not how I understand Genesis. As I understand it, and as it has been explained to me by several fundamentalists, unclean animals were brought aboard by twos - not two pairs. That would make one queen and one drone of a whole lot of communal insects. In fact, in termites, ants and bees, the queen mates with multiple partners only once in her life, when these insects swarm. One female and one male just doesn't cut it.
 
Then you have to decide whether to take any non-breeding female workers and the colony apparatus, or whether you want to take care of the queens and their later offspring yourself until the colonies can function on their own again.
That's a good point. Certainly none of these communal insects would have been able to reproduce without the workers to care for the eggs and feed the larvae. That is a problem that would be true of all of the Hymenoptera - and yet, we have many species of ants, bees, and wasps.
 
PS I find that it is much more fun, with much less aggro, to agree with Creationists and work around to the contradictions, rather than to tell them they're wrong.
I particularly enjoy presenting the problems that arise from the creationist position and asking them to explain. Maybe your method is better since mine results in creationist exit from the discussion.
 
Of course people in that advanced state of cognitive dissonance are as incapable of seeing their contradictions as if they had been hypnotized. Cognitive dissonance was first described in a church where the prediction of the end of the world on a certain day had failed, and the church grew as a direct result.
Of course, they like to talk about how science is based on assumptions or presuppositions, while 'creation science' is based on TROOTH. All you need to do is start from the 'assumption' or 'presupposition' that the Bible is literally true in every detail, and then reject all facts and observations that disagree. That's creationism.
